p: While public health measures might be practical in wealthy countries with well-established and relatively stable health care systems, the question of how the pandemic will affect low- and middle-income countries, as observed in South America or on the African continent, still remains unanswered ( Ntoumi and Velavan, 2020, Wang et al., 2020). The international community is obliged to pay attention to the spread of COVID-19 in low-income countries, as health systems could become severely overburdened, and the pandemic could continue to elude control, hitting hardest those with the least protection.
